title: The X Factor: Celebrity: Nicole Scherzinger showcases her toned frame in metallic ballgown
text:
She has made her return to The X Factor after two years away from the panel.

And Nicole Scherzinger commanded attention as she slipped into a glittering ballgown for the debut live show of The X Factor: Celebrity on Saturday.

The former Pussycat Dolls hitmaker, 41, shimmered in a slinky silver sequin dress which emphasised her ample cleavage and slender waist.

Shimmer: Nicole Scherzinger commanded attention as she slipped into a glittering ballgown for the debut live show of The X Factor: Celebrity on Saturday

The dress flowed into a clinging glittering skirt, with the star pairing this with vertiginous heels.

She later donned a bejewelled cape as she gave her thoughts on the celebrity acts.

Her raven tresses were styled in loose waves while her pretty features were enhanced with smoky shadow, fluttery lashes and coral gloss.

Saturday night saw Ricki Lake and Olivia Olson become the first acts to be eliminated from the X Factor: Celebrity.

Glitter: The former Pussycat Dolls hitmaker, 41, shimmered in a slinky silver sequin dress which emphasised her ample cleavage and slender waist

Pert: The dress flowed into a clinging glittering skirt, with the star pairing this with vertiginous heels

Emotions: Nicole looked gorgeous as she took to the stage at the show

After landing in the bottom three alongside Martin Bashir, the chat show Queen was the first to be booted off the show after receiving the lowest votes.

Simon Cowell then made the final decision between Martin and Olivia, with the music mogul sending the Love Actually star home - a move that didn't go down well with 'disgusted' viewers.

This series of the ITV singing competition had several changes from the usual version, including no sing-off between the bottom two contestants.

Hugs: Louis was grinning as he embraced Nicole during the show on Saturday night

Embrace: Louis put a hand on Nicole's waist as he looked around her, left, before giving her a hug, right, after the fellow judge had taken off her glitzy cape

Shining: Nicole looked fantastic in her dazzling ensemble and wore her long locks down

Deciding between the two acts, Nicole chose to save her own act Martin, while Louis Walsh opted to keep his act Olivia.

The deciding vote was down to Simon, who declared that he wanted to save the person that he thought the viewers would want to see progress in the competition.

After learning her fate, Olivia broke down in tears, stating: 'I'm not okay' after host Dermot asked how she felt.

Glamour: She later donned a bejewelled cape as she gave her thoughts on the celebrity acts

However, viewers at home were left fuming over Simon's decision as he appeared to vote for popularity over actual talent.

Taking to Twitter to air their views, one person wrote: 'This is why people turn off X Factor, total joke that Olivia should be sent home.'

While another declared: 'Someone should remind Simon Cowell that the X Factoris a singing competition. He’s been handing out fashion advice and putting through people who can’t sing. The man has actually lost his marbles. No wonder Little Mix left Syco.'
